Comment: Reposted—since it got removed:  A quarter of U.S. adults see Chinese Americans as a "threat"; Fewer than half (44%) of Americans strongly agree that Japanese American incarceration was wrong.  This is a step backwards in America. Would not be completely surprised about Yellow Peril 2.0 and internment camps under this Administration.   Also, it’s disheartening as an Asian American to see whenever a prominent Asian/Chinese American speaks on behalf of the US on the trade war, such as Nvidia CEO, Jensen Huang or ScaleAI CEO, Alexandr Wang—there will always be some comments questioning their loyalty and allegiances. I know some families dating back since the Gold Rush—before Trump’s German grandfather ever set foot to the States. The whole birthright citizenship law stemmed from a Chinese American being denied his citizenship. There needs to be greater education on Asian American history.
